alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 3:13AM EST until February 23 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION CONTINUES THROUGH THE MORNING... .Snow, heavy at times, will continue this morning before tapering off late morning. Sleet will mix in across far southern NH, also tapering late this morning. Light snow showers or freezing drizzle will be possible this afternoon before another period of snow and mixed precipitation arrives this evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 5 and 7 inches for a storm total of 7 to 10 inches. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...A snowstorm will bring plowable snow to the region with a period of moderate travel impacts expected. Periods of moderate snow and low visibility will be the biggest hazards. The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and extremely dangerous travel conditions. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
